content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is an example implementation of the `add_yearmonth` function in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = map(x -> Dates.yearmonth(x), df.dt)
    df.ym = map(x -> x.year * 100 + x.month, df.ym)
    return df
end
```

You can use this function to add the `ym` column to your DataFrame with the desired formatting. Note that this assumes that the `dt` column contains DateTime objects from the Dates package. If your `dt` column does not contain DateTime objects, you will need to convert them before using this function.
